article.headline: Mercer 93, Charleston Southern 92
article.story: CHARLESTON, S.C. (AP) -- James Florence scored 28 points, including the winning shot with a second to go, as Mercer beat Charleston Southern 93-92 on Monday night. The Buccaneers (4-5) had just broken a tie with seven seconds to go on a free throw by Giedrius Knysas before Florence's jumper gave Mercer (2-5) its first lead of the second half. Florence was fouled on the play and missed his free throw. But Charleston Southern didn't have enough time to get off a shot. The Bears (2-5) trailed 79-69 with just under seven minutes to go, but scored eight points in less than two minutes to erase nearly all the deficit. Charleston Southern hit only 3-of-8 free throws in the final minute, and missed three of four foul shots in the final 10 seconds. Jamarco Warren led the Buccaneers with 22 points. Omar Carter scored 21 points and had 10 rebounds, while Chris Moore added 19 points. Calvin Henry scored 20 points and pulled down 10 rebounds and Shaddean Aaron added 16 points and eight rebounds for Mercer.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
